thread.title: Estonia ready to support Armenia in establishing peace
thread.title_full: Estonia ready to support Armenia in establishing peace

title: Estonia ready to support Armenia in establishing peace
text: Estonia ready to support Armenia in establishing peace March 9, 2024 - 14:27 AMT PanARMENIAN.Net - Estonia is ready to support Armenia in establishing peace and security in the region, Foreign Minister of Estonia Margus Tsahkna said at a meeting with Armenian parliament speaker Alen Simonyan on Friday, March 8. “Armenia is a friendly country for us,” Tsahkna said, haling the country’s. commitment to the peace agenda. “Estonia is ready to support Armenia in every possible way in establishing peace and security in the region.” According to the press service of the Armenian National Assembly, Simonyan noted that Armenia is committed to the agenda of establishing peace in the region and presented the process of Armenia-Azerbaijan negotiations. Top stories The Cabinet of Ministers decided on Thursday, November 9 to allocated AMD 120 million to arrange the gathering. Michael Roth believes sanctions must be put on the table after Baku‘s ethnic cleansing in Nagorno-Karabakh. The Yerevan City Council has elected Tigran Avniyan from the ruling Civil Contract as the mayor of the Armenian capital. The Armenian Parliament on Tuesday, October 3 voted to ratify the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court. Partner news Latest news
